page.title: 19CUSTOMS AND THE SUPERNATURAL
page.content: Each year during Whitsuntide all the churches of Haydock gather for their {walking day.}A custom that owes its origins to the depression years is that of{Play Days.}Here the men played bowls, piggy, raced pigeons and whippets racing them at "flapping tracks"; this ceased in late 1950's. Many{ghost tales}centre around the public houses, but one tells about the ghost of a nun who is say to walk around the Sankey Valley Park; or the story of the green man killed in a fire who now haunts the new Queensway offices. Richard Evans school is called{Jaggers after the very first head.
